intro: Ligustrum delavayanum, commonly known as Delavay's privet, is a species of flowering plant in the Oleaceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types. Ligustrum delavayanum is also used in traditional medicine in some regions for its purported health benefits.
